column1: Today is #SmallBusinessSaturday! I encourage all Alabamians to #ShopSmall & support the local businesses that are the economic engine of our state. Many businesses have options in place for safe shopping. Check with your local stores to see what responsible services they offer. https://t.co/R6AO72SAXM

Wishing everyone a very happy #Thanksgiving. Today we remember what we're grateful for such as family friends and freedom. I am also thankful for our first responders and military personnel who protect our liberties and freedoms today and every day. https://t.co/SLlmA6qQBB

The @USAirForce has selected Maxwell Air Force Base in #Montgomery to host the new MH-139 Grey Wolf helicopter. The decision highlights and reinforces our state's success in supporting a robust national defense. This is excellent news for #Alabama. https://t.co/UkbRnMUF1a

Great news! @NSF recently awarded @SamfordU $1 million in grant funding aimed to boost #STEM opportunities for community college transfers. This award will establish scholarships while applying data and research to increase #STEM academic success and degree completion.

Thank you to each and every one of the brave men and women who put their lives on the line to protect and defend our freedoms. I commend their strength and courage and am grateful for their dedication and selfless service to our nation. #VeteransDay https://t.co/yYYFFAEykQ

I’d like to wish the @USMC a happy 245th birthday. Their unwavering commitment and sacrifice for our great country is an inspiration to us all. We’re grateful for their service today and every day. https://t.co/OX5rbfQuD3

Our Republic relies on the integrity of our electoral system. Both parties should want fair and honest elections. Fraud and the perception of fraud erodes confidence and is damaging to the freedoms and liberties envisioned and established by our forefathers.
Time after time we have demonstrated our willingness to work together and get the job done. We have before us the opportunity to deliver for the American people once again. https://t.co/lHbdDOMmRx

By & large these bills are the product of bipartisan cooperation among members of the Senate Appropriations Cmte. As negotiations w/ the House begin in earnest I look fwd to working w/ @NitaLowey @SenatorLeahy & @RepKayGranger to resolve our differences in a bipartisan manner.

ICYMI – @BusinessInsider declared #Huntsville the best city to move to for people seeking early retirement because of the #RocketCity’s growing opportunities for high-paying jobs and low cost of living. #Alabama https://t.co/CMpnJ0e8v4

Earlier today @Hyundai announced their decision to add a 5th vehicle to their Montgomery production plant. This selection is a result of a positive long-term partnership between Hyundai & the #Montgomery community. I look forward to the benefits to come from this great news. https://t.co/ezOOOasMgJ
Congratulations to @TTuberville on his victory last night. I look forward to serving with him in the Senate as we work to support and protect the needs of Alabama and the nation.

I am proud to have voted to confirm Judge Amy Coney Barrett to serve on the #SCOTUS. Throughout my career in the Senate I have never seen a more qualified judicial nominee. I'm confident she will serve our country with honor on our nation’s highest court. https://t.co/ZBtMFHAG2X

In a few hours the Senate will vote on the nomination of Judge Amy Coney Barrett – a remarkably qualified #SCOTUS nominee. I look forward to supporting her for this role and once again urge my colleagues to do the same. She is an exemplary choice for our nation's highest court.

As a country we should seek to have judges who are thoughtful fair-minded & respectful. Judge Barrett exemplifies all of these traits. I have the utmost confidence that she will serve the Court & this country with honesty & integrity. My full remarks: https://t.co/XkIlG5fOBR

Today I spoke on the Senate floor regarding the nomination of Judge Amy Coney Barrett who I consider to be the most qualified Supreme Court nominee that I have encountered in my 34 years in the United States Senate. #SCOTUS https://t.co/fBovcqB5Jz
Very sad to hear about the Navy trainer aircraft that crashed in Foley. My thoughts and prayers are with the families of the two service members who lost their lives.

Proud to announce that @USDA has awarded #Alabama $37M for 6 rural broadband infrastructure projects which will help provide high-speed internet access to thousands of central Alabamians in a time where connectivity & remote access are paramount. https://t.co/YmIoBUTbJ2

Today in #Alabama the @FBI formally expressed their support of the @RocketCenterUSA's newest #STEM camp program Cyber Camp. I am confident that this partnership will expand the existing curriculum and provide great opportunities for cyber education. https://t.co/4GJTSUgF6e

Senate Democrats have again blocked hundreds of billions of dollars in COVID relief. Families and businesses are struggling. This senseless gridlock must stop for their sake. They deserve better. https://t.co/9MR7o7QGLa

I’m pleased to have worked with @US_EDA to support a $1.7M grant for the Port of Epes infrastructure project which will help create jobs & fuel the local economy – enabling long-term economic benefits to West Alabama. Looking forward to its completion. https://t.co/Y0uALcgOz2

Great news for NW Alabama– @ARCgov has awarded @BevillState a $1.5M #POWER grant to create a Rapid Training Facility on the Hamilton campus with courses focusing on #welding & #HVAC. The facility will offer hands-on training teaching marketable skills to those looking for work.

Happy 245th birthday to the @USNavy! Thank you to the men and women who have served and continue to serve our nation on the water with honor courage and commitment. #Navy245 #USNavy https://t.co/U2x1HmNFdF

Judge Barrett is experienced and committed to upholding the Constitution. She'd be an exceptional member of the SCOTUS bringing a unique American perspective to the highest court in the land. It's past time Democrats stop attacking her based on her personal religious beliefs.

Good news! @USDA is investing $3.05M in Distance Learning and Telemedicine grants in Alabama which will help rural residents gain access to health care and educational opportunities. https://t.co/TnqcjRr2FI

Nearly $25 million in federal assistance has been approved by @FEMA to help #Alabama residents recover from the effects of #HurricaneSally. For more information on these resources: https://t.co/OQLWEMfJ7g
Wishing the President @realDonaldTrump and First Lady Melania Trump @FLOTUS a speedy recovery. My thoughts and prayers are with all those impacted by #COVID19.

I’m proud to have led the efforts in Congress to fund the Great Red Snapper Count. Preliminary results show there are 3X the amount of #RedSnapper in the Gulf of Mexico as previously estimated. Hopefully this data will allow for more #RedSnapper fishing opportunities in the Gulf. https://t.co/mpJzrrQ1Gv

After speaking with Judge Barrett I am confident that she is the right choice to serve on the Supreme Court. Judge Barrett is exceptionally qualified for this role and maintains strong conservative values and a deep commitment to our Constitution. https://t.co/d71aYCHUkb

Excited to announce that the @USDOL in partnership with the @ARCgov and @DeltaRegional has awarded two WORC grants to @wallacestate and @LBWCC. Both grants will help continue the development of a skilled and ready workforce in #Alabama: https://t.co/LQKTOKSFST

Judge Barrett is an excellent choice and will make a great Supreme Court Justice. I will enthusiastically support her confirmation and I encourage my colleagues to join me in moving her nomination expeditiously. https://t.co/52Y8CTCPlo

Proud to announce that @usedgov has awarded @MadeinAL over $17M. This investment was made possible by the CARES Act and will fund the Alabama Workforce Stabilization Program which will help provide educational & training opportunities for workers displaced by #COVID19. https://t.co/rANXhlttVY

Earlier this week the @SBAgov announced disaster relief loans for counties impacted by Hurricane #Sally. Please visit the following link to find information on the loans and how to apply: https://t.co/S7FfG6vpLu https://t.co/FpdH9vMgn0

Congress should act on a targeted #COVID19 relief measure to help small businesses and those in need. This will boost our economy and recovery efforts. Time is of the essence. We need to pass a measure now.

The #2020Census deadline is less than a week away. The results of the 2020 Census will impact communities throughout Alabama. Please visit https://t.co/pZnPTUZ888 or call 844-330-2020 by September 30th to ensure you and your family are counted. #ALCounts

.@fema recently approved AL’s disaster declaration for Hurricane #Sally. Federal funding to aid in the recovery efforts is now available to affected individuals in Baldwin Escambia and Mobile Counties. Assistance can be applied for online: https://t.co/H5nn5BcUg7

As flooding persists throughout Alabama please continue to listen to local officials and take the proper precautionary measures in the coming days. Additionally the following link includes information from @fema related to flood damaged property: https://t.co/1ADzmBbQ9B
Important announcement for Alabama’s agriculture industry. Thank you @USDA! https://t.co/bpCyAHYd2C

As Hurricane #Sally makes its way inland please continue to listen to local officials monitor the weather for your area closely and stay off the roadways if at all possible to allow first responders to reach those in need. https://t.co/exZ0C5zuxW
Please visit my website for additional links to resources related to Hurricane #Sally: https://t.co/BzNm072mwG https://t.co/goFS5yIQqr

As Hurricane #Sally prepares to make landfall I encourage all Alabamians to download the FEMA App which provides real-time alerts from the @NWS assists in locating open emergency shelters and more. You can download the app here: https://t.co/JwFKodMMSo https://t.co/qjPLAQlmZl
As Hurricane #Sally approaches please take the proper precautionary measures stay informed and be safe. https://t.co/uI9cT9zZjZ

Today on September 11th we pause to remember the Americans we lost 19 years ago after the attacks on our country. Let us honor them by never forgetting their incredible courage and sacrifice. #NeverForget https://t.co/uOyABXvvX8

I am proud to announce that @USDOT has awarded two BUILD grants to Alabama. Both grants will provide important federal resources that will improve infrastructure and promote increased economic development opportunities in #Alabama. https://t.co/emwhrB7GuH
This is great news for Alabama’s coast. This airport tower will help Baldwin County grow expand and compete for additional economic expansion opportunities in the future. https://t.co/oTpqt2xTBb

Excited to announce that @NSF has awarded @UofAlabama $6 million to harness data and implement a framework that will provide new insights & groundwater predictions. This grant will build on the work of UA's world-class water research institute @AlabamaWater.

Great news! @NSF recently awarded @UofAlabama @UAHuntsville & @AuburnU a combined total of $1.5M in grant funding! These funds will go towards various research projects that will advance science and engineering in #AL.

Great news! Today @mazda_toyota announced an additional $830M investment in their manufacturing plant in Huntsville. These dollars will incorporate more advanced technologies to its production lines and enhance workforce training.  https://t.co/RZ9phxyzJp

Proud that @SpaceForceDOD has chosen an Alabama-made rocket to support our national security in space. Congratulations to everyone at @ulalaunch that has worked on the #VulcanCentaur. This award will help ensure we continue to lead in space.

.@FAANews announced the decision to grant @UAHuntsville $1.1M to help develop innovative strategies to effectively deploy drones in response to emergencies. Grateful @USDOT continues to invest in Alabama.  https://t.co/kdm1o6Rhe0
Important reminder for all Alabamians: Please remember to fill out your #2020census. Respond online here: https://t.co/DrOtLP0hBg https://t.co/QlIZNiXxBu
Happy birthday to the @USCG! We appreciate your service today and every day. https://t.co/Lvjw1oK5Mz
This morning the @NASAPersevere Mars rover launched on @ULAlaunch #AtlasV rocket – returning to Mars and paving the way for future human exploration. #CountdownToMars https://t.co/WtklWRf8af

Today the Senate confirmed Dana Wade to be Assistant Secretary of @HUDgov. Her public service experience & extensive knowledge of housing issues set her up for success in this role. Confident she'll positively assist @FHAgov especially during this critical time for our nation.

#Huntsville’s U.S. Space & Rocket Center home of the famous @SpaceCampUSA is known for laying the foundation of careers in aerospace engineering science education etc. Proud of opportunities @RocketCenterUSA provides & look forward to future success. https://t.co/SosyTNhbXV
That I believe is the key to unleashing the American economy and hitting our stride as a nation once again. https://t.co/7Mu2GZnPVf

The American people are fighters but the accumulated strain of this pandemic is a serious burden. With the additional resources this legislation provides I believe we can give them greater confidence that we are getting our arms around this virus.
Today my colleagues & I introduced the HEALS Act - our plan to aid American families & businesses suffering from the #COVID19 global pandemic. I believe we need to act with a sense of urgency.
This weekend the life of John Lewis was celebrated throughout Alabama. Congressman Lewis served our nation honorably and his legacy will live on for generations to come. https://t.co/BPqNy3P6vN

Today’s Senate passage of the #FY21NDAA is a vital step in providing for our men & women in uniform. With continued emerging threats it is critical that we prioritize a strong national defense. Proud my colleagues and I were able to advance this measure. https://t.co/HwnYbSoCB8

.@MarionMilitary Institute in #PerryCounty was ranked the 7th best community college in the nation. Proud to see this #Alabama institution recognized for their excellence on a national stage. https://t.co/VfeFIXswg0
Today is an important day in #Alabama. Please remember to get out and vote in today’s election. #ElectionDay #Vote

Happy Independence Day! Today we celebrate our freedom and recognize those who have bravely served and sacrificed so that we may enjoy liberties as an independent nation. Please remember to stay safe as you enjoy the holiday. #IndependenceDay #July4th https://t.co/KJUcJfSX0T

Today I attended the Labor-HHS Appropriations hearing to review Operation Warp Speed – our nation’s effort to find a safe effective #COVID19 vaccine. Questioned @NIHDirector @CDCDirector & @BARDA’s Dr. Disbrow on where we are in the process & when we can expect results. https://t.co/p2PMejrqYe
Good news! 4.8 million jobs were added in June. Our economy is moving in the right direction. More to come.

.@SecArmy’s visit to @Dynetics in #Huntsville highlights the critical role #Alabama plays in defending our nation. Proud the @USArmy is prioritizing the development of hypersonic systems and pleased Secretary McCarthy saw firsthand the progress being made in our state.

Proud @GovernorKayIvey is taking steps to ensure the safety of all Alabamians as we continue work to combat #COVID19. Please follow the #SaferatHome order through July 31st and continue wearing face masks and following @CDCGov guidelines. https://t.co/rICtlcErfQ

.@USDOT just announced another round of @FAANews grants for #Alabama providing $10.75 million for 16 airports in the state to enhance safety & boost aviation advancements. I look forward to the positive impact this funding will have throughout Alabama. https://t.co/XTm8sEyvUg

Important reminder for all small businesses in #Alabama! The deadline to apply for the #PaycheckProtectionProgram is Tuesday June 30th. Follow @SBAGov’s link below to apply now for assistance during #COVID19: https://t.co/QlcgDFyMWg
Additional #COVID19 resources are now available online for Alabama’s farmers: https://t.co/fuWlQCkZ2U

Disappointed my Democratic colleagues blocked us from even considering or debating the #JUSTICEAct. This bill is the proper vehicle for us to quickly pass meaningful reforms to help all Americans feel safe & protected in their communities.

The Senate just confirmed @POTUS’s 200th judicial nominee. These judges will positively impact our judicial system & our country for generations to come – providing impartiality & fairness. Looking forward to even more progress as we continue on this path. https://t.co/xt0TB7iPeF

It is my hope that my colleagues on both sides of the aisle are willing to work together to pass the #JUSTICEAct and implement reforms that will help all Americans feel safe and protected in their communities.

This bill will help police departments across our nation to implement practical reforms such as banning chokeholds training officers on de-escalation practices requiring body-worn cameras and sharing officer disciplinary records.

Proud to be a cosponsor of @SenatorTimScott’s #JUSTICEAct – which focuses on police reform accountability and transparency. This bill highlights issues facing our nation that must be addressed. All Americans should have trust and confidence in our justice system.

I am extremely grateful for the support of the @USACEHQ & the work of the @AlabamaPortAuth to ensure this project which I have spent years championing crosses the finish line with ease. https://t.co/OoSalKgytr

Today @USACEMobile & @AlabamaPortAuth officially entered into a Project Partnership Agreement to deepen & widen the #Mobile Harbor Ship Channel. The completion of this historic project will transform #Alabama expanding economic opportunities throughout our state & the region.

Reminder for all Alabamians: As we work together to safely reopen continue to adhere to @CDCgov’s #COVID19 safety measures. Please wear face masks practice social distancing & respect guidelines set by stores/businesses. You never know who may be at a greater risk. #TogetherAL https://t.co/PQgTPWRqTK

Today @CommerceGov announced the decision to award a $1.6M @US_EDA grant to the city of #MuscleShoals to establish critical stormwater drainage #infrastructure in North AL. Grateful this Administration continues to prioritize modernizing & protecting #Alabama’s infrastructure. https://t.co/M5PbZ9LLNM

Today at the @BankingGOP hearing I questioned @FederalReserve Chairman Powell about the #economy jobs report & how we can resume business activity during & after #COVID19. Look forward to working together to get our economy back up and running efficiently & effectively.
Good news for @Austal_USA and for these 15 @MobilePublicSch students! https://t.co/4ZpPvGulwl

.@NSF is again investing in our state! @UofAlabama is receiving $1.6 million to improve numerical methods research ecology and fund various studies. These awards will further #Alabama’s scientific research abilities and allow continued success in #STEM fields.

Today we celebrate the 245th birthday of the @USArmy – the oldest branch in the US military established in 1775. I would like to thank the brave soldiers in the #USArmy for protecting our freedom & defending our nation in times of need. #ArmyBirthday #ServeWithHonor

Today is the 140th anniversary of US-Romanian diplomatic relations. Recently during the #COVID19 pandemic Romania deployed a medical team to #Alabama to provide medical reinforcements for hospitals nursing homes and long-term care facilities. I am grateful for their help.

Glad to see the @USNavy’s Littoral Combat Ship highlighted for paving the way in regard to emerging surface countermine & anti-submarine capabilities. Proud of the great work done by @Austal_USA to build these ships in #Mobile. https://t.co/0H3XaiadoI

SiO2 Materials Science in #Auburn is receiving $143M to accelerate production of their packaging platform for storing #coronavirus vaccines & therapeutics - adding 200 skilled manufacturing jobs. Proud this #Alabama company is working to combat #COVID19. https://t.co/bVE4LXx3lA

Today marks 76 years since American troops stormed the beaches of Normandy. We owe our utmost gratitude to the Greatest Generation as we remember and honor those who fought for our freedom. #DDay76 https://t.co/k1FMpTDFfG

According to @USTreasury 60909 in #Alabama have received #PPP loans totaling $6112333061 through May 30th. The Paycheck Protection Program is clearly working in our state & throughout the nation. Proud more relief is officially on the way!

Today @POTUS signed the #PaycheckProtectionProgram Flexibility Act – providing relief for #smallbiz. The bill allows businesses granted loan forgiveness to receive payroll tax deferment extends deadline for #smallbiz to rehire workers receiving unemployment benefits & more.

More help is on the way for small businesses in #Alabama & across the nation: The Senate passed changes to improve the historic Paycheck Protection Program – furthering the program’s ability to protect American workers families & small businesses. #PPP

I am saddened to hear about the death of former @AuburnU football coach Pat Dye. He will be long remembered throughout the state of Alabama for the impact he had on his players and the Auburn community. I know his legacy will live on for years to come.

Encouraging news for #AL from @NIH: #UAB has been awarded $587941 to conduct a study to quantify undetected cases of #coronavirus infection. Proud @UABNews is continuing work to fight the negative effects of #COVID19.
Historic day for @NASA! Proud we are launching humans from American soil for the first time in almost a decade. https://t.co/Uu7f7uVdw9

Today @USDAFSA started accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. #CFAP will provide much-needed assistance to the farmers and ranchers in #Alabama and throughout the U.S. impacted by the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/oAYm5p45Xa

Proud #Huntsville’s own Jeffrey Neill a @Toyota Motor Manufacturing #Alabama skilled maintenance team member was honored at the @WhiteHouse for completing the Advanced Manufacturing Technician program offered through @Toyota & @CalhounCollege. https://t.co/UE4jkzs91M

Each year we set aside time to remember those who made the ultimate sacrifice to protect our great nation. We are forever indebted to the selfless soldiers who gave their lives for our freedom. It’s an honor to celebrate these fallen heroes today and every day. #MemorialDay2020 https://t.co/O1Io9Pa21c

Exciting announcement about Dauphin Island from @NOAAFisheries: @DISeaLab is receiving a roughly $300000 grant to restore the oyster population and boost production levels enhancing aquaculture in the area. Grateful @NOAA continues to invest in #Alabama. https://t.co/WbTx8NmAEm

I am encouraged by the recent @FHFA proposal to bolster capital requirements for both GSEs. Sufficient capital is essential to best serve the housing market and protect American taxpayers. I commend Director Calabria’s efforts and leadership on this important issue.

Proud to congratulate this year’s U.S. Presidential Scholars from #Alabama: Kittson Hamill from #Huntsville HS Isaac Stubbs from #Wetumpka HS & Lawrence Zhang from James Clemens HS – who were each selected for their academic accomplishments community service & leadership. https://t.co/YvRZ5B0BiJ

Today @POTUS announced his intent to nominate Eddie LaCour of #Montgomery to be a U.S. District Judge for the Middle District of #Alabama. He is a highly-qualified candidate for this esteemed role and I believe he will be a great addition to our nation’s judicial system.

I just had a good meeting with the President about FY21 appropriations and the important need to protect our nation’s veterans' health care as the process gets underway. We had a productive conversation and I look forward to moving the process forward.

Anna Manasco’s extensive litigation experience academic accomplishments & strong commitment to upholding the rule of law as it is written make her the ideal candidate for this role. I’m confident she'll serve honorably exhibiting fairness & impartiality.https://t.co/kMidpGUgMg

Excellent news: The Senate just confirmed #Birmingham’s own Anna Manasco to be a U.S. District Judge for the Northern District of #Alabama. She is immensely qualified & her confirmation today is a victory for our state & the entire nation.

Good news – The Senate has invoked cloture on the nomination of Anna Manasco of #Birmingham to be a U.S. District Judge for the Northern District of #Alabama. Looking forward to her confirmation vote this afternoon. https://t.co/KAZtqo9P1x

Mobile's Airbus team continues to expand operations! @AirbusInTheUS officially inaugurated production activities in a newly-built Final Assembly Line hangar & started production of the first US-built A220. Proud to see the company reaching new milestones in #Alabama!

.@NOAA is allocating $88M in fishery disaster funding as a result of flooding in the Gulf of Mexico in 2019 including close to $9M for #AL’s commercial fisherman & seafood processors. Proud to have secured this funding to help AL's fishing communities recover from this disaster.

Great news: #Alabama state & federal waters will be open for #redsnapper fishing on May 22! Looking forward to another prosperous season for our state’s fishermen - especially with the Snapper Check program providing accurate timely data. https://t.co/PVg454f7Ig
Excellent news for #Alabama farmers! Check out @SecretarySonny’s direction on how to be prepared for @USDA’s upcoming #CFAP application process: https://t.co/URrmarHqRe

Big news from @LockheedMartin! India’s selection of the MH-60R “Romeo” multi-mission helicopter for their Navy – which is built right here in #Alabama – is excellent news for #Troy and will preserve jobs & economic stability in the area. https://t.co/ZvPAjHp9dm

Great news for #AL: @NSF is awarding a total of $160750 in grant funding to @UAHuntsville @Sprhill & @Disealab to support #STEM education & various research projects. Grateful #NSF continues to invest in our state!

This week reminds us of the selfless bravery police officers display. These men & women put our safety above their own and for that we stand forever grateful. My deepest condolences remain with the families and loved ones of these fallen heroes. https://t.co/cJGzxY3cpE

Honored to have co-sponsored a Senate resolution declaring May 10-16 2020 as #NationalPoliceWeek. This week we have the opportunity pay tribute to the 8 brave police officers from #Alabama & many more across the nation who made the ultimate sacrifice last year to protect us.

Encouraged to see the @DeptVetAffairs launched a new resource to assist #veterans & others across the nation during the #COVID19 crisis. Grateful the Department is working to relieve the stress and anxiety of those who may be struggling. https://t.co/84lLh0toxE

This week is National #CharterSchoolsWeek. Grateful to charter schools in #AL and across the nation for going #AboveAndBeyond to invest in students families and communities. Keep up the good work! https://t.co/8Jd1k3CbuQ

Good news: @CBP Air & Marine Operations is funding a $27M contract for the conversion of 3 HH-60 helicopters to UH-60 Lima Black Hawks through an interagency partnership with the @USArmy Utility Helicopter Project Office located in #Huntsville. https://t.co/KasJLiv6tF

.@WaterWellTrust is expanding the number of #AL counties eligible to receive assistance for drilling a new water well or rehabilitation of an existing well. Grateful this national nonprofit is working to ensure Alabamians have access to clean safe water. https://t.co/x16OkABO73

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram continues to assist many #smallbiz in #AL! As of May 8th 30647 loans amounting to $1525755462 were approved for #Alabama during the 2nd round of #PPP funding. Proud @SBAgov & @USTreasury are still working hard to provide #COVID19 relief.

Happy #MothersDay to all the mothers in #Alabama and across the nation. Despite the current circumstances I hope everyone is able to celebrate their mom today. I am especially grateful for my wife Annette and all she does for our family.

May is National #MilitaryAppreciationMonth. I commend all members of the U.S. military – both former and present – for their service and dedication to our nation. We are forever indebted to these brave heroes. https://t.co/LMPUCaHjxS

This week is #NursesWeek! I want to thank all of the dedicated nurses throughout #AL & across the nation – not only for their selfless efforts during the #COVID19 crisis but also for their hard work & devotion to protecting & saving lives all the time.

Today @NOAA announced their plan to provide $300 million to assist the U.S. fishing industry in mitigating impacts caused by #COVID19. This includes $3.3M for #Alabama! I am proud to have fought to include this funding in the #CARESAct.

While it’s not a normal day in the Senate I am still hosting my Republican colleagues for a social distancing lunch. My gift to them includes @JimnNicksBBQ cheese biscuit mix and some #Alabama pottery from @AlabamaGoods. #MadeinAlabama https://t.co/sVyZvCFUvN

Today the Senate @BankingGOP Committee held a hearing to consider the nomination of Dana Wade to be @FHAgov commissioner. Her prior public service & extensive knowledge of housing issues make her well-suited for this position.

Today the @AlabamaNG will conduct a flyover to honor healthcare workers first responders and other essential employees for their efforts during the #COVID19 crisis. Proud these hardworking Alabamians are being recognized and commended! https://t.co/L54JDfwmQp

Happy #TeacherAppreciationWeek to all of AL's hardworking teachers. Proud of their efforts to invest in the lives & education of students – and especially grateful for their willingness to go above and beyond during #COVID19. Let’s take time this week to celebrate our #teachers.
Great news for Alabama’s #agriculture industry! https://t.co/K8pIkvGljk

Glad the Acting Secretary of @DHSGov Chad Wolf took the time to speak to @AuburnU students virtually today addressing the department’s response to the #COVID19 crisis & other current issues. Proud of the partnership that exists between #DHS & our state. https://t.co/LarG4FPRxC

Proud that #Alabama's own Vaneeza Rupani named @NASA’s Mars helicopter. Her grasp on the importance of exploration is extraordinary & I am confident that she has a bright future ahead. Congratulations to Ms. Rupani of #Northport on being selected for this prestigious honor! https://t.co/SM1KeRcIYu

Excellent news for 25 local #AL airports! @USDOT has awarded $61 million in @FAANews grants to support aviation #infrastructure improvements and allow operations to continue as they work to minimize the negative effects of #COVID19. https://t.co/dvemu1ER9d

Vestavia Hills High School won their division at @CivicEducations’s We the People National Finals Challenge which was held virtually this year. Proud of this accomplishment highlighting the students’ understanding of our government. #WTPFinals https://t.co/w7l7lalcka

Here’s a great opportunity for #AL students interested in #aviation: @FlightWorksAL is providing online education activities during the #COVID19 crisis. Visit https://t.co/LzRBFCvyn8 to be a part of it!

.@YMCAHuntsville’s Brown Bag Bus feeding program is delivering meals to children impacted by school closures in #Madison #Marshall & #Morgan counties due to #COVID19. The @YMCA is providing nearly 1000 meals each day that otherwise would have been supplied through school lunch. https://t.co/DOCkATDfcA
Grateful for this effort by @ULALaunch: https://t.co/3c2YxGFZdv
Great news from @USTreasury. Looking forward to the #PaycheckProtectionProgram being back up and running again on Monday! https://t.co/5fJ42AQNKt
Looking forward to the implementation of this funding which will continue allowing the #PPP to have a significant impact on many #Alabama small businesses.

Excellent news for #AL & the nation: @POTUS has signed the #PaycheckProtectionProgram & Health Care Enhancement Act providing additional funding to assist small businesses & meet urgent healthcare needs of American families & workers during the #COVID19 public health pandemic.

Critical equipment to combat & prevent #COVID19 is being created & donated by @UAHuntsville. Glad the campus community is coming together to assist healthcare workers across the Tennessee Valley during this time. https://t.co/HakM1aci00

Spoke with @SenateMajLdr today. I believe widespread #COVID19 testing is the key to safely reopening the entire US economy. That is how we get out of this dilemma; not by spending trillions & trillions more. We cannot continue to rack up nat’l debt without knowing what’s working.

States and localities facing this head-on are in desperate need of federal support. Delivering these resources and providing relief is our responsibility.
A crisis of this magnitude demands bold action and considerable resources and that’s what we’re working to provide for American families workers and businesses in this bipartisan package.

Proud we're finally closer to addressing this urgent matter. The #CARESAct contains $340B in emergency supplemental funding for those suffering due to this crisis. More than 80% of total funds in the #appropriations division will go directly to state & local govts & communities.

The American people need our help in the midst of this emergency. I urge my colleagues across the aisle to help us agree on a comprehensive package so we can provide critical resources for those in need during this time of unease throughout our nation. Time is of the essence.

Instead we are allowing the Treasury Secretary to make or guarantee collateralized loans to industries whose operations the Coronavirus outbreak has jeopardized. In my judgment this approach strikes an appropriate balance between providing assistance and protecting taxpayers.

American businesses didn’t cause this crisis & aggressive action is warranted to ensure they have the liquidity necessary to weather its direct impacts. But let’s be crystal clear about what we are & are not doing here. We're not bailing out airlines or other industries - period.
